Dashboard¶

Dashboard.dashboard_setup.main()¶

This file intends to build a dashboard using streamlit to provide end user visualization and analysis.

Dashboard.feature_analysis.app()¶

Build function for multi page streamlit aaplication - feature analysis section loads the data, sets up the instruction section and correlation plots

Dashboard.feature_analysis.setup_correlation_plots(data)¶

sets up bar plots for feature analysis with interactive widgets param: data pandas dataframe

Dashboard.home_page.app()¶

main function to set up the streamlit application visuals on the home page

Dashboard.home_page.make_header()¶

setup header section and allow user to select/input data file for analysis

Dashboard.instructions.setup_instruction_section_exploration()¶

This function sets up visual explanations on how to use our provided dashboards in the exploration section.

Dashboard.instructions.setup_instruction_section_feature_analysis()¶

This function sets up visual explanations on how to use our provided dashboard in the prediction section.

Dashboard.instructions.setup_instruction_section_prediction()¶

This function sets up visual explanations on how to use our provided dashboard in the prediction section.

class Dashboard.multiapp.MultiApp¶

Bases: object

Frameworks for running multiple Streamlit applications as a single app. referrencing https://github.com/upraneelnihar/streamlit-multiapps

add_app(title, func)¶

Adds a new application. :param func: the python function to render this app. :param title: title of the app. Appears in the dropdown in the sidebar.

run()¶
Dashboard.plots.app()¶

Build function for multi page streamlit aaplication - exploration section loads the data, sets up UI explanations and deals with file uploads

Dashboard.plots.data_summary(df)¶

set up the data summary section param: df pandas DataFrame

Dashboard.plots.setup_distribution_plot(train, fatigue_score, gender_options, designation, company_options, wfh_options)¶

sets up a plot that is controlled with the sidepanels to control the distribution of the data in a histogram param: train training data dataframe param: fatigue_score slider value of fatigue score param: gender_options selected gender options from sidebar param: designation delected designation range from sidebar param: company_options selected company options from sidebar param: wfh_options selected wfh options from sidebar

Dashboard.plots.setup_male_female_avg_plot(train)¶

sets up the plot for average gender fatigue score – static for now, can be adapted for dymanic change param: train input training dataframe

Dashboard.prediction.app()¶

Application function for the prediction section - sets up instructions, model and handles file uploads

Dashboard.prediction.data_encoder(df)¶

Applies binary encoding to entire dataframe param: data pandas Dataframe with column “WFH Setup Available returns: encoded pd.DataFrame with binary encoded categorical variables

Dashboard.prediction.download_link(object_to_download, download_filename, download_link_text)¶

Generates a link to download the given object_to_download.

object_to_download (str, pd.DataFrame): The object to be downloaded. download_filename (str): filename and extension of file. e.g. mydata.csv, some_txt_output.txt download_link_text (str): Text to display for download link.

Examples: download_link(YOUR_DF, ‘YOUR_DF.csv’, ‘Click here to download data!’) download_link(YOUR_STRING, ‘YOUR_STRING.txt’, ‘Click here to download your text!’)

param: object_to_download pd.DataFrame param: download_filename String param: download_link_text String returns: HTML String

Dashboard.prediction.get_data()¶

used for store multiple user input

Dashboard.prediction.get_mitigation_strategies(burnout_score)¶

decides on mitigation strategy strings to be shown for a particular burnout score param: burnout_score float returns: (string, string) categorical score of burnout and mitigation strategies

Dashboard.prediction.get_user_input()¶

setup the user inputs section and store inputs as dataframe then use model to predict burnout rate

Dashboard.prediction.predict(xtest, res)¶

predict burnout rate using user input data param: xtest pd.DataFrame param: res pd.DataFrame returns: pd.DataFrame

Dashboard.prediction.wfh_encoder(data)¶

Encodes the WFH setup to Binary param: data pandas Dataframe with column “WFH Setup Available” returns: Bool

Dashboard.sliders.setup_interaction_items()¶

sets up the sidebar elements for streamlit returns: selected fatigue score and designation range, if males or females were selected, selected industry type and selected work setup

Dashboard.utils.check_data_format(train)¶

checks if the uploaded data has all required columns param: train pd.DataFrame returns: Bool

Dashboard.utils.load_data()¶

loads the data from the data subdirectory

Dashboard.utils.wrong_data_format_message()¶

Displays error message on streamlit when the uploaded file has the incorrect format
